channel.title: Eda on Balint Bojko
channel.description: Recent content in Eda on Balint Bojko

item.title: Cereal Clustering
item.description: Setting up work environment rm(list=ls()) library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(reshape2) library(factoextra) library(rgl) library(car) library(corrplot) #Loading Data data <- read_csv('cereal.csv') #Scaling data by weight datasc <- cbind(data[,1:3],data[,4:16]*(1/data$weight)) #Normalizing data (norm(0,1)) datasc <- cbind(data[,1:3],scale(data[,4:16])) Plotting histograms to explore features ggplot(melt(datasc[,4:16]),aes(x=value)) + geom_histogram(bins = 15) + facet_wrap(~variable) ## No id variables; using all as measure variables Keeping calories, protein, fat, carbs and sugars to explore classes,and only keeping type = cereal datasc <- datasc[datasc$type=='C',] datasc <- datasc[,c(1,4,5,6,9,10)] #also for data data <- data[data$type=='C',] Exploring principal components, printing Eigenvalues
